title: Resistivity - 1-point-5 meter wire of radius 1 mm

content.question: A long wire has a length of <math alttext="1.5 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>, a circular cross-section of radius <math alttext="1.0 millimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>mm</mi></math>, and a resistance of <math alttext="0.10 ohm" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>. What is the resistivity of the wire material?

choices.label: <math alttext="2.1 times 10 to the negative 7 power, ohm meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

<math alttext="6.7 times 10 to the negative 5 power, ohm meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1.5 times 10 squared, ohm meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

<math alttext="4.8 times 10 to the fourth power, ohm meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2.1 times 10 to the negative 7 power, ohm meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
